item.title: The Indie Game Awards 2025—How I Voted
item.content:encoded:
The Indie Game Awards took place on Thursday, December 18, and saw 21 awards handed out to deserving games, developers, and people.

This year, I was lucky enough to be selected as one of the judges and had the opportunity to vote on 12 awards. Those included the likes of Music, Gameplay, Narrative, Game of the Year, and more.

While the awards were given out already, I thought it would be good to show the Insider Gaming audience how I voted this year. To be completely honest, it was a lot tougher than I expected.

Doing a ranked choice vote led to plenty of second guessing and dozens of pages of notes in my black and white marble notebook. There was even a time where I had my votes all ready to submit, only to start over by reviewing my notes again. Eventually, decisions were made and the ballots were sent in.

Not all of my selections won, but I was happy with how I voted and congratulate all of the winners. There really were so many incredible games this year that you could make a strong case for every game that was nominated, and even others that weren’t. But, without any more delay, here’s how I voted for The Indie Game Awards 2025.

The Indie Game Awards 2025 – Mike Straw’s Ballot

All of the games under each category appear in the order that I voted. It was a ranked choice vote, meaning that I had to place the games in the order I felt they belonged. It wasn’t just a “pick one from this list”.

Bite-Sized Game

  1. This game will end in 205 clicks
  2. CARIMARA – Beneath the Forlorn Limbs
  3. Many Nights a Whisper
  4. The Dark Queen of Mortholme
  5. Time Flies (WINNER)
  6. Flyknight

Community Management

  1. Strange Scaffold
  2. Team PEAK (WINNER)
  3. Game Smithing Limited
  4. Sassy Chap Games
  5. Jenn Jiao Hsia

Debut Game

  1. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (WINNER)
  2. Discounty
  3. Fretless
  4. Sorry We’re Closed
  5. ILA: A Frasty Glide
  6. Tyrant’s Realm

Emotional Impact

  1. Wanderstop
  2. And Roger (WINNER)
  3. Wednesdays
  4. Don’t Get Your Hopes Up
  5. Afterlove EP
  6. Henry Halfhead

Gameplay Design

  1. Hades 2
  2. Absolum
  3. BallxPit (WINNER)
  4. Pipistrello and the Cursed Yoyo
  5. Hollow Knight: Silksong
  6. Keep Driving
  7. Dawnfolk
  8. Look Outside
  9. Ooo
  10. The King is Watching

Innovation 

  1. Blue Prince (WINNER)
  2. Freeride
  3. Gas Station Story
  4. PBJ The Musical
  5. Taria & Como
  6. Ruggy and the Riverside

Music

  1. Sword of the Sea
  2. Rift of the NecroDancer (WINNER)
  3. Herdling
  4. Everhood 2
  5. SONOKUNI
  6. Wheel World

Narrative

  1. The Drifter
  2. Citizen Sleeper 2 (WINNER)
  3. Consume Me
  4. The Rootrees are Dead
  5. Promise Mascot Agency
  6. The Seance of Blake Manor

Achievement in Accessibility

  1. Squeakross
  2. Spray Paint Simulator
  3. PEAK (WINNER)
  4. Barista
  5. ABiotic Factor
  6. Calm the Storm

Solo Development

  1. Megabonk 
  2. Tall Trails (WINNER)
  3. NAIAD
  4. Lushfoil Photography
  5. Sim
  6. Spilled!
  7. Vile: Exhumed

Visual Design

  1. Slime Rancher 2
  2. Artis Impact
  3. Cat Detective Albert Wilde
  4. 30 Birds (WINNER)
  5. Mashina
  6. Eclipsium

Game of the Year

  1. Blue Prince
  2. Hades 2
  3. Absolum
  4. Pipistrello and the Cursed Yoyo
  5. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (WINNER)
  6. Hollow Knight: Silksong
  7. Citizen Sleeper 2
  8. And Roger
  9. Consume Me
  10. Keep Diving

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1645: Hints and Answer for December 20, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1645 for December 20, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, December 20, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1645 will be a little bit easier than yesterday’s. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.3 of 6 guesses. That makes over a full guess harder than the 4.3-guess average from December 19.

General Wordle Hints For December 20

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word can describe both a color and a condition or state.
  • Hint 2: The word is commonly used in symbolic or descriptive writing, not just literal contexts.
  • Hint 3: It’s frequently paired with another word to describe something being clean, clear, or blank.
  • Hint 4: It was a nice day for one of these weddings.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1645 for December 20, 2025

Starter Words For December 20, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • WORLD
  • THIEF
  • WHILE
  • WRITE

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1645 On December 20, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: WHITE

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

WHITE is a noun or adjective. As a noun, it means “a color without hue at one extreme end of the scale of grays, opposite to black”. As an adjective, one meaning is “light or comparatively light in color.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1644 on December 19, 2025:

Answer: MYRRH

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1645?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on December 21 will be Wordle Game #1646.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.
